passages.text: Top stories: 1) DH results (mixed but special sit), 2) Scout24 CEO buying shares, 3) Boohoo results (mixed; still UW) and co- founder buying shares, 4) Meituan results readover (modestly reassuring), 5) Ionos new product officer.
Companies in headlines: Auto1, Hemnet, IONOS, Scout24, Ryanair/eDreams, M&S Company with results: Boohoo, Delivery Hero Company read across: Meituan (covered by Jiong Shao)
FIGURE 1. \*\* Chart of the Week \*\* Auto1's used car price index edging lower in August. Used car prices remain up c.+5% YTD. Auto1 is a key OW in our EU Internet space.
Source: Company data, Barclays Research
This research report has been prepared in whole or in part by equity research analysts based outside the US who are not registered/qualified as research analysts with FINRA.
Please see analyst certifications and important disclosures beginning on page 13. Completed: 29- Aug- 25, 12:14 GMT Released: 29- Aug- 25, 13:30 GMT Restricted - External
European Internet POSITIVE Unchanged
- Delivery Hero (OW) - Q2 earnings: Remains a special sit into YE (29 August 2025)- Boohoo (UW): FY25 model update; becoming clearer but outlook tough (29 August 2025)
Online Classi Redds Companiesetnet, out24

- Hemnet Hemnet appoints new Chief Sales Officer (Press Release, 26/08/2025) Hemnet has appointed Marcus Westerlund as Chief Sales Officer, expanding its management team to provide ties with Sweden's real estate agents. Marcus Westerlund has led the sales organisation since 2024 and will now oversee both sales and customer service.
Barclays' view. We see the organisational shift as positive, signals a clear strategic focus on deepening agent relationships.
- Scout24 - Scout24 CEO Share Purchase (Bloomberg, 29/08/2025) Scout24 CEO Ralf Weitz purchased €100,522 worth of shares on 27 August, according to a regulatory filing.
Barclays' view. CEO buying shares is positive, signals confidence in execution. OW.
Companies: Delivery Hero, Meituan/DH/ Talabat read across

- Delivery Hero - Q2 earnings: Remains a special sit into YE (Barclays Research, 29/09/2025) Key takeaways: 1) Financials: Group GMV growth \(c + 7\%\) at cFX ex HI accounting (vs Q1 +8%), +11% LfL basis vs 10% in Q1 (ex discontinued ops) and +3% on a reported basis. Within this, Asia making progress, MENA good momentum, Americas slowdown and Europe flat QoQ. Group revenue in Q2 up \(c + 19\%\) on reported basis. Group EBITDA in H1 was \(\sim\) 411m and Group FCF in H1, ex one offs, was \(\sim\) 8m. 2) Glovo tech stack integration completed. 3) Talabat stake update - no plans to sell. 4) Provisions & contingent liabilities H2/FY25 update. 5) FY25 guidance revised lower on clean basis. 6) Regional update: MENA (Turkey, KSA), South Korea, APAC ex-SK, Americas.

Barclays' view. Mixed print with trimmed guidance, but fundamentals are not the key driver into year- end. We see multiple scenarios around Prosus, activist pressure, and value crystallisation potential. Risk/reward remains attractive, in our view, but clearly if nothing happens by the end of the year and Prosus starts to place shares in the market, this would be unhelpful for the stock. On balance, we like the trade into YE. OW.

- Meituan (covered by Jiong Shao) - Q2 earnings read across: The Battle May Not Last Forever; But The War Will; Long-term Margins Structurally Lowered (Barclays Research, 27/08/2025) Key takeaway is that competition within the food delivery industry has materially intensified for Meituan. In 2Q25, Meituan's gross margin dropped -8ppts yoy, S&M expenses were up 52% yoy, and operating cash flow declined -75% yoy while only delivering a 8% yoy top-line growth for the core local commerce segment. Key comments on call around Keeta: 1) Meituan reiterated its intention to become a global company, with Keeta as the international growth vehicle, but emphasised a measured approach to market entry. 2) The company highlighted rapid progress in Hong Kong and Saudi Arabia, where Keeta has already reached top-tier market positions, and noted recent expansion into Qatar. 3) Brazil remains under evaluation, with a small team conducting market research. 4) Management remains optimistic about Keeta's long-term potential, targeting RMB100bn GMV by 2033, while stressing the importance of local market understanding and operational discipline.
Barclays' view. Read across to DH and Talabat is marginally positive. Perhaps we are over reading but the Meituan tone could have been more aggressive; the UAE wasn't mentioned and

the Saudi rollout seems to be largely complete. But clearly plenty of uncertainty. Jahez spent more in Q2 on promo but growth was solid. It is hard to know how much Delivery Hero has spent on Hungerstation within disclosure (some but not a huge sum) but growth was also solid in Q2. So the reader in Saudi feels manageable, in our view. We are tracking the other GCC markets closely - Qatar (Talabat incumbent) will be next to monitor closely in coming weeks.
Companies: eDreams/Ryanair

- Ryanair / Booking (covered by Trevor Young) / eDreams - Ryanair and Booking.com reach tickets deal after long legal dispute (Reuters, 26/08/2025) Ryanair has reached a settlement with Booking Holdings, allowing Booking.com, KAYAK, Priceline, and Agoda to resell its tickets, ending a multi-year legal battle over unauthorised ticket listings and data scraping. The deal ensures full price transparency and direct flight updates for customers, aligning with Ryanair's recent strategy of formalising resale partnerships, including prior agreements with Kiwi.com and Expedia.

Barclays' view. Booking was one of the last OTAs with eDreams having not signed an agreement with Ryanair. OTA dispute between Ryanair (covered by Andrew Lobbenberg) and eDreams remains. eDreams has now lapped through the comp headwind and is seeing KPIs re- accelerate, which is reassuring. We still think a resolution with Ryanair could act as a tailwind, potentially unlocking additional traffic and inventory for the platform, though the nuance of any terms would be important.
Companies: Auto1, Boohoo, M&S

- Auto1 - Used car prices edge lower in August (Press release, 29/08/2025) AUTO1 Group's Price Index fell slightly in August 2025, declining c.-1% month-over-month to 140.9 from 141.9 in July. Despite the dip, prices remain up \(\sim +4\%\) YTD and c.+3% yoy vs Aug'24.
Barclays' view: The modest monthly decline suggests some stabilisation in price following strong gains earlier in the year. We continue to monitor supply dynamics and consumer demand.
- Boohoo - Carol Kane buys shares (Investing, 29/08/2025) Boohoo co-founder Carol Kane purchased 6.86m shares at 14.50p each, taking their total shareholding to 1.99% of the company.
Barclays' view. Clear positive signal from the co-founder and current board member of Boohoo's view on the future direction of the share price.

- Boohoo - FY25 model update; strategy becoming clearer but outlook tough (Barclays, 29/08/2025) Post FY25 results (y/e 28 Feb 2025), we update our model. Boohoo is in the early stages of a multi-year turnaround strategy. Performance recovery of the company now rests on three key pillars: scaling Debenhams' asset-light marketplace model across the Group, expanding margins, and 'right-sizing' the Youth Brands, which we view as the most structurally challenged. While Debenhams is showing encouraging growth, its current scale is small (~£650m GMV). We remain cautious on the feasibility of replicating the asset-light model across the Youth Brands, where operational complexity and brand positioning may limit its effectiveness. Although the mid-term strategy is becoming clearer, we believe it will take time to translate into results, and Boohoo's outlook remains challenged.

Barclays' view. MT strategy clearer, but execution will take time and outlook remains challenged. PLT sale could unlock some value, though we expect any valuation to be materially below what Boohoo originally paid & no obvious buyer at this stage. Valuation challenging with lack of +ve NT FCF/EPS.

- Re-commerce - M&S launches resale service with eBay (Independent, 26/08/2025) M&S is working with eBay to launch its first dedicated resale service. The move lets M&S customers trade in and use MS items in-store or online and shop for secondhand goods on the official M&S x eBay store. Customers are incentivised to donate their clothes with the offer of £5 off their next £35 spend. Any items that can't be resold are recycled by Reskinned.

Barclays' view. We think the global resale market could grow 2- 3x faster than the global e- commerce market, reaching \(\sim \$ 200bn\) by 2029 (see New Horizons: The return of resale). It is supportive that incumbents are additionally looking to move into this space. Jury still out whether resale will be cannibalistic to retail incumbents, and we think the winners will likely be those who are early adopters/investors in the resale proposition.

- IONOS - New Chief Product Officer appointed (Press release, 27/08/2025) IONOS has announced the appointment of Dr. Andreas Nauzer as Chief Product Officer, effective 1 September 2025. Dr. Nauzer joins from Bosch Digital, where he served as CTO and board member. He will oversee IONOS' global product strategy, portfolio, and innovation, with a focus on cloud computing and generative AI.

Barclays' view. His experience includes 18 years at IBM, including most recently as Senior Technical Staff Member at IBM Cloud. Helpful signal that IONOS is moving forward and focusing on Cloud/Al product innovation.

Overweight - The stock is expected to outperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a 12- month investment horizon.
Equal Weight - The stock is expected to perform in line with the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a 12- month investment horizon.
Underweight - The stock is expected to underperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a 12- month investment horizon.
Positive - industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are improving.
Neutral - industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are steady, neither improving nor deteriorating.
Negative - industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are deteriorating.

Sustainable Investing Related Research: There is currently no globally accepted framework or definition (legal, regulatory or otherwise) of, nor market consensus as to what constitutes a 'sustainable', 'ESG', 'green', 'climate- friendly' or an equivalent company, investment, strategy or consideration or what precise attributes are required to be eligible to be categorised by such terms. This means there are different ways to evaluate a company or an investment and so different values may be placed on certain sustainability credentials as well as adverse ESG- related impacts of companies and ESG controversies. The evolving nature of sustainable investing considerations, models and methodologies means it can be challenging to definitively and universally classify a company or investment under a sustainable investing label and there may be areas where such companies and investments could improve or where adverse ESG- related impacts or ESG controversies exist. The evolving nature of sustainable finance related regulations and the development of jurisdiction- specific regulatory criteria also means that there is likely to be a degree of divergence as to the interpretation of such terms in the market. We expect industry guidance, market practice, and regulations in this field to continue to evolve.

Any information, data, image, or other content including from a third party source contained, referred to herein or used for whatsoever purpose by Barclays or a third party ("Information"), in relation to any actual or potential 'ESG', 'sustainable' or equivalent objective, issue, factor or consideration is not intended to be relied upon for ESG or sustainability classification, regulatory regime or industry initiative purposes ("ESG Regimes"), unless otherwise stated. Nothing in these materials, including any images included therein, is intended to convey, suggest or indicate that Barclays considers or represents any product, service, person or body mentioned in these materials as meeting or qualifying for any ESG or sustainability classification, label or similar standards that may exist under ESG Regimes.
